qas.question: How many theaters approximately are located in Hanover?
What is the Schauspielhaus in English?
Who does the Cumberlandsche Galerie belong to?
Which theatre is Hanover's big theatre for musicals, shows and guest performances?
Which theater has it's own musical company?
How many theaters are in the area surrounding Hanover?

plausible_answers.text: The Opera House, the Schauspielhaus (Play House), the Ballhofeins, the Ballhofzwei and the Cumberlandsche Galerie belong to the Lower Saxony State Theatre.

qas.question: What buildings belong to the upper Saxony State Theatre?
What is the only theater without its own musical company?
Who performs classical musicals in the Garden Theater?

context: <b5_0>Around <a0_0>40<b5_0/><a0_0/> theatres are located in Hanover. <b6_0>The Opera House, the Schauspielhaus (<a1_0>Play House<a1_0/>), the Ballhofeins, the Ballhofzwei and the Cumberlandsche Galerie belong to the <a2_0>Lower Saxony State Theatre<a2_0/>.<b6_0/> <b9_0>The <a3_0>Theater am Aegi<b9_0/><a3_0/> is Hanover's big theatre for musicals, shows and guest performances. The Neues Theater (New Theatre) is the Boulevard Theatre of Hanover. <b7_0>The <a4_0>Theater für Niedersachsen<b7_0/><a4_0/> is another big theatre in Hanover, which also has an own Musical-Company. Some of the most important Musical-Productions are the rock musicals of the German rock musician <b8_0>Heinz Rudolph Kunze<b8_0/>, which take place at the Garden-Theatre in the Great Garden.
